p: Volatiles with α,β-unsaturated cabonyl groups (such as enones and enals) often react with nucleophilus in fungi through the Michael reaction to create chemical modifications and interrupt fungal growth [ 43] of C. acutatum, Colletotrichum fragariae, C. gloeosporioides, Fusarium oxysporum, B. cinerea, and Phomopsis sp. Nevertheless, the accessibility of α,β-unsaturated carbonyl groups to bulky nucleophile biomolecules plays an important role in their antifungal activity [ 44].
